stories.text:
Any suggestions of databases with the following Use cases: 1. Database supporting 3 to 4 terabytes of data that has fast read, slow updates/deletes (taking a couple of seconds to delete is fine). 2. Sql queries are scheduled to run every 15 minutes which dumps data from delta lake to another database (this is the db this post is about) to update/delete tables in that database. 3. Those tables have heavy reads. 4. While the tables are being updated some rows are being updated/deleted(could also be no rows updated) and at the same time reads are being performed. Aggregations are being performed on those rows. How do we ensure that the read performed on the tables only aggregate the data after the rows are updated i.e. no intermediate results? Should this be atomic?

|delta lake| ==sql queries==> | db we need|

We wanted to use Clickhouse (as "db we need" in above diagram) but its update/delete is actually done with garbage collection (it's done at some point but we don't know when).

Any suggested databases? Given that we needed fast read speed we considered olap databases e.g. druid, pinot.
stories.title: Any suggested databases with fast read slow updates/deletes

stories.text:
I'm the sort of person who builds and builds and builds and builds.

I've built many SAAS services but none have succeeded.

The thing I've never done is marketing - everyone says this is why none of my projects have succeeded.

I feel certain that marketing isn't just one simple thing - I must be looking for marketing advice as it relates to SAAS applications in the modern world - 2020/2021/2022.

It feels extremely hard to learn marketing because it's all so intangible.

So, exactly how do I learn marketing? What do I read?
stories.title: Ask HN: I'm addicted to coding, how do I learn marketing? Got tangible advice?
